result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick Taylor Sternig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obtain Prescription Drug w/ Fraud, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge by 03-29-2017 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept. Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

With credit for 4 days.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION
Consecutive to: any other sentence

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Patrick Taylor Sternig in court with attorney Robert Michael Courtney.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

On motion of the state, the court amended the charge to Obtain Prescription Drug w/ Fraud, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 450.11(h), a class U Misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

Court sentenced defendant to serve FOUR (4) DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for FOUR (4) days served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 03-29-2017 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.
Due to the unavailability of the Court,  matter is RESCHEDULED to 03-29-2016 at 08:30 am for Review.  sdg
Case calendared off the Record to 03-21-2016 at 01:30pm.

Defendant Patrick Taylor Sternig in court with attorney Robert M. Courtney.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense requests an adjournment to provide UA's.  State does not object.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Patrick Taylor Sternig in court with attorney Robert M. Courtney.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.

Order for No Gun or Drugs received and filed.  Review hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Patrick Taylor Sternig in court with attorney Robert M. Courtney.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Motion hearing, however parties no longer wish to have a motion hearing and request a DPA hearing instead.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Patrick Taylor Sternig in court with attorney Robert M. Courtney.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
State's witness is unavailable on todays date. Court grants State's request for an adjournment. Case rescheduled for MOTION HEARING on 8/26/2015 at 1:30 pm. Court vacates the trial date.  Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Patrick Taylor Sternig in court with attorney Robert M. Courtney.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for MOTION HEARING on 7/9/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15. Any motions are to be filed by 6/15/2015 and any response from the State is to be filed by 7/7/2015. Case also calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 8/6/2015 at 1:30 pm and JURY TRIAL on 8/12/2015 at 9:00 am.   Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Patrick Taylor Sternig in court with attorney Robert M. Courtney.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 6/1/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription, Oral No Weapons Order,  DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (5/8/15). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 05-11-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Patrick Taylor Sternig
Current: 3241 West Forest Hill Avenue, Franklin, WI 53132   (Effective: 05-07-2015)
Prior: 3241 West Forest Hill Avenue, Franklin, WI 53132
Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for scheduling in Branch 15.vb

Defendant Patrick Taylor Sternig in court with attorney David John Molter.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Patrick Taylor Sternig not in court.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/5/15 @ 1:30 pm
